treatment.description: Plants in tufts, not stoloniferous, weakly rhizomatous (with bulbils at leaf bases). Leaves basal and cauline (basal ephemeral); petiole flattened, 5–15 mm; blade reniform, 5–7-lobed usually more than halfway to midvein (cauline less-lobed distally), 5–20 mm, thin to slightly fleshy, margins entire, eciliate, apex obtuse to acute, surfaces glabrous or glabrate to ± long-hairy. Inflorescences 2–5-flowered cymes, 5–18 cm, purple-tipped stipitate-glandular; bracts petiolate. Flowers: sepals erect, (sometimes purplish), ovate to lanceolate, margins glandular-ciliate or eciliate, surfaces glabrous; petals white, sometimes with purple veins, not spotted, obovate to narrowly oblanceolate, 7–15 mm, longer than sepals; ovary 1/4–1/3 inferior. 2n = 26, 48, 52.
